intro: Caraguata sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe-headed caraguata, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spherical flower heads, which are composed of numerous small, white to pale pink petals. Its leaves are typically broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Caraguata sphaerocephala is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
